resource.title: Morris S. Lazaron papers
resource.abstract: The Morris S. Lazaron papers describe the career of Morris S. Lazaron, rabbi, community leader, and an important personality in 20th century American Reform Judaism. The collection spans the years 1851-1979 and includes correspondence, sermons, manuscripts, published articles, congregational papers, scrapbooks, and personal items.
resource.extent: 18.4 linear feet; 46 Hollinger boxes; one oversize box

nameEntries.original: The Jacob Rader Marcus Center of the American Jewish Archives

               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unitid>MC 622, T-367; MP-11; Phon-53</unitid>

                     <extref>Schlesinger Library, Radcliffe Institute</extref>
                  </repository>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Calderone, Mary Steichen, 1904-1998</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <unittitle>Additional papers of Mary Steichen Calderone, <unitdate>1914-1989</unitdate> (inclusive), <unitdate>1960-1989</unitdate> (bulk)</unittitle>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>19.31 linear ft.</extent> (44 ½ files boxes, 3 card file boxes) plus 1 folio+ folder, 1 oversize folder, 1 supersize folder, 8 photograph folders, 1 folio photograph folder, 26 audiotapes, 1 motion picture, 4 phonograph disks.</physdesc>
                  <langmaterial>Materials in English.</langmaterial>
                  <abstract>Additional papers of Mary Steichen Calderone, physician and pioneer in the field of sex education, consisting of biographical material, speeches, conference material, correspondence, writings, audiotapes, photographs, clippings, etc.</abstract>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
